PandaController.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 """
3 This is a panda pose library, this is comprised of three main types of classes
4 1) General Utilities: defs utilized by all classes
5 2) Static Defs: All defs starting with static.
6  Used only for static data collection
7 3) dynamic Defs: All defs starting with dynamic.
8  Used for dynamic data collection only
9 Each Pose should be defined in this way
10 poses_list = [
11  [[-1, -pi / 3, -pi / 4, 1, 1, 1, -pi / 4],
12  [0, 0, 0.5, 0, 0, 0, 0], 'Pose_1'],
13  [[-0.5, -pi / 3, -pi / 4, 1, 1, 1, -pi / 4],
14  [0, 0, -0.5, 0, 0, 0, 0], 'Pose_2']
15  ]
16 Which is basically:
17 poses_list = [
18  [[Position List_1], [Velocity_list_1], 'Pose_name_1'],
19  [[Position List_2], [Velocity_list_2], 'Pose_name_2']
20  ]
21 """
22 import rospy
23 from math import pi
24 import numpy as np
25 
26 from std_msgs.msg import Float64
27 from sensor_msgs.msg import JointState
28 from trajectory_msgs.msg import JointTrajectory, JointTrajectoryPoint
29 from PandaControllerManager import ControllerType, PandaControllerManager # noqa: E402
30 
31 
32 class PandaController(object):
33  """
34  This is the main PandaController class.
35  The main reason this class needs to be overridden is
36  that you can rospy.init_node
37  once. Hence. You need to call this super method.
38  """
39 
40  def __init__(self, is_sim=True):
41  # Create Publishers and Init Node
42  """
43  Panda Controller class for controlling the panda in
44  both simulation and in real life
45 
46  Arguments
47  ---------
48  `is_sim`: `bool`
49  Whether the controlled robot is from simulation or not.
50  """
51  self.is_sim = is_sim
52  rospy.init_node('panda_pose', anonymous=True)
53  self.trajectory_pub = self.get_trajectory_publisher(is_sim)
54  self.position_pubs = self.get_position_publishers()
55  self.velocity_pubs = self.get_velocity_publishers()
56 
57  self.pcm = PandaControllerManager()
58  # Prepare msg to send
59  self.msg = JointTrajectory()
60  self.msg.header.stamp = rospy.Time.now()
61  self.msg.header.frame_id = '/base_link'
62  self.msg.joint_names = ['panda_joint1', 'panda_joint2',
63  'panda_joint3', 'panda_joint4', 'panda_joint5',
64  'panda_joint6', 'panda_joint7']
65 
66  # Set Initial position of the robot
67  self.point = JointTrajectoryPoint()
68  self.point.positions = [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0]
69  self.point.velocities = [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0]
70  self.point.accelerations = [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0]
71  self.point.time_from_start.secs = 1
72  self.msg.points = [self.point]
73  # TODO: Look up do we need to have one message to init the robot?
74  # If I only send one message,
75  # then the franka bottom-most joint does not move in simulation.
76  # Need to check if same thing happens in real robot too.
77  # @peasant98 can you please confirm this?
78  # TODO: This might not be the best starting position
79  # for the robot to be in.
80  # Think about if we are losing some information by
81  # using a completely vertical position
82  # for the start.
83  # Move arm to starting position
84  # self.trajectory_pub.publish(self.msg)
85  rospy.sleep(1)
86  # self.trajectory_pub.publish(self.msg)
87  rospy.sleep(1)
88 
89  self.sleep_time_static = rospy.get_param('/static_sleep_time')
90  self.r = rospy.Rate(rospy.get_param('/dynamic_frequency'))
91  self.pose_name = ''
92 
93  rospy.Subscriber('/joint_states', JointState, self.joint_state_callback)
94  self.joint_states = JointState()
95 
96  @property
97  def joint_names(self):
98  """
99  Gets the joint names of the Panda.
100  """
101  return self.msg.joint_names
102 
103  @property
104  def joint_angles(self):
105  """
106  Gets the current joint angles of the Panda.
107  """
108  index = [self.joint_states.name.index(joint_name) for joint_name in self.joint_names]
109  return [self.joint_states.position[idx] for idx in index]
110 
111  @property
112  def joint_velocities(self):
113  """
114  Gets the current joint velocities of the Panda.
115  """
116  index = [self.joint_states.name.index(joint_name) for joint_name in self.joint_names]
117  return [self.joint_states.velocity[idx] for idx in index]
118 
119  def joint_state_callback(self, joint_states):
120  """
121  Joint state callback for the Panda.
122 
123  Arguments
124  ---------
125  `joint_states`: `JointState`
126  The joint state message received from the Subscriber.
127 
128  """
129  self.joint_states = joint_states
130 
131  def joint_angle(self, joint_name):
132  """
133  Gets the joint angle for the Panda's
134  corresponding joint name.
135 
136  Arguments
137  ---------
138  `joint_name`: `str`
139  The name of the joint on the Panda.
140 
141  """
142  idx = self.joint_states.name.index(joint_name)
143  return self.joint_states.position[idx]
144 
145  def joint_velocity(self, joint_name):
146  """
147  Gets the joint velocity for the Panda's
148  corresponding joint name.
149 
150  Arguments
151  ---------
152  `joint_name`: `str`
153  The name of the joint on the Panda.
154 
155  """
156  idx = self.joint_states.name.index(joint_name)
157  return self.joint_states.velocity[idx]
158 
159  def set_joint_position_speed(self, speed=1.0):
160  """
161  Sets the joint position speed for the Panda.
162  However, this is not implemented yet.
163 
164  Arguments
165  ---------
166  `speed`: `float`
167  The speed in rad/s of the joints.
168 
169  """
170  rospy.logerr('Set Joint Position Speed Not Implemented for Panda')
171 
172  # General Utilities
173  def get_trajectory_publisher(self, is_sim):
174  """
175  Sets the correct topic to publish a `JointTrajectory`
176  message to. This is dependent on if we are in simulation or
177  not.
178 
179  Arguments
180  ---------
181  `is_sim`: `bool`
182  If Panda is in simulation or not.
183 
184  """
185  topic_string = '/panda_joint_trajectory_controller/command' if is_sim else '/joint_trajectory_controller/command'
186  return rospy.Publisher(topic_string, JointTrajectory, queue_size=1)
187 
188  def get_velocity_publishers(self):
189  # create a list of velocity publishers.
190  self.joint_velocity_controller_names = ['panda_joint%s_velocity_controller' % (i) for i in range(1, 8)]
191  joint_velocity_pubs = []
192  for name in self.joint_velocity_controller_names:
193  pub = rospy.Publisher('/%s/command' % (name), Float64, queue_size=10)
194  joint_velocity_pubs.append(pub)
195  return joint_velocity_pubs
196 
197  def get_position_publishers(self):
198  self.joint_position_controller_names = ['panda_joint%s_position_controller' % (i) for i in range(1, 8)]
199  joint_position_pubs = []
200  for name in self.joint_position_controller_names:
201  pub = rospy.Publisher('/%s/command' % (name), Float64, queue_size=10)
202  joint_position_pubs.append(pub)
203  return joint_position_pubs
204 
205  def send_once(self):
206  """
207  Sends one `JointTrajectory` message.
208  """
209  self.pcm.switch_mode(ControllerType.TRAJECTORY)
210  self.trajectory_pub.publish(self.msg)
211  rospy.sleep(1)
212  self.trajectory_pub.publish(self.msg)
213  rospy.sleep(1)
214 
215  def publish_positions(self, positions, sleep):
216  """
217  Set joint positions of the panda with the
218  Panda Joint Position Controller
219 
220  Arguments
221  ----------
222  positions: list
223  Set the joint positions according to the list that you get
224  sleep: float
225  Set how long it should wait after commanding a command
226 
227  Returns
228  ----------
229  return: None
230  """
231  self.pcm.switch_mode(ControllerType.POSITION)
232  if len(positions) != 7:
233  raise Exception("The length of input list should be 7, as panda has 7 joints")
234  for index, pos in enumerate(positions):
235  self.position_pubs[index].publish(Float64(pos))
236  rospy.sleep(sleep)
237 
238  def publish_velocities(self, velocities, sleep):
239  """
240  Set joint velocities of the panda with
241  the JointVelocityController.
242  Arguments
243  ----------
244  positions: list
245  Set the joint velocities according to the list that you get
246  sleep: float
247  Set how long it should wait after commanding a command
248 
249  Returns
250  ----------
251  return: None
252  """
253 
254  self.pcm.switch_mode(ControllerType.VELOCITY)
255  if len(velocities) != 7:
256  raise Exception("The length of input list should be 7, as panda has 7 arms")
257  for index, vel in enumerate(velocities):
258  self.velocity_pubs[index].publish(Float64(vel))
259  # sleep a bit of time
260  rospy.sleep(sleep)
261  for pub in self.velocity_pubs:
262  pub.publish(Float64(0.0))
263 
264  # self._publish_all_values(sleep)
265 
266  def publish_accelerations(self, accelerations, sleep):
267  """
268  Set joint velocities of the panda
269 
270  Arguments
271  ----------
272  positions: list
273  Set the joint velocities according to the list that you get
274  sleep: float
275  Set how long it should wait after commanding a command
276 
277  Returns
278  ----------
279  return: None
280  """
281  self.pcm.switch_mode(ControllerType.TRAJECTORY)
282 
283  if len(accelerations) != 7:
284  raise Exception("The length of input list should be 7, as panda has 7 arms")
285  for index, _ in enumerate(accelerations):
286  self.point.accelerations[index] = accelerations[index]
287 
288  self._publish_all_values(sleep)
289 
290  def publish_trajectory(self, positions, velocities, accelerations, sleep):
291  """
292  Set joint trajectory (positions and velocities) of the panda
293 
294  Arguments
295  ----------
296  positions: list
297  Set the joint positions according to the list that you get
298  velocities: list
299  Set the joint velocities according to the list that you get
300  sleep: float
301  Set how long it should wait after commanding a command
302 
303  Returns
304  ----------
305  return: None
306  """
307  self.pcm.switch_mode(ControllerType.TRAJECTORY)
308 
309  if len(positions) != 7:
310  raise Exception("The length of input list should be 7, as panda has 7 arms")
311  if len(velocities) != 7:
312  raise Exception("The length of input list should be 7, as panda has 7 arms")
313 
314  for index, _ in enumerate(positions):
315  self.point.positions[index] = positions[index]
316  self.point.velocities[index] = velocities[index]
317  self.point.accelerations[index] = accelerations[index]
318 
319  self._publish_all_values(sleep)
320 
321  # End General Utilities
322  def _publish_all_values(self, sleep):
323  """
324  This will just set all the values and send the trajectory msg
325  to ros master. This should be used for static data collection
326 
327  Arguments
328  ------------
329  sleep: float
330  Set how long it should wait after commanding a command
331 
332  Returns
333  --------
334  return: None
335  """
336  self.pcm.switch_mode(ControllerType.TRAJECTORY)
337 
338  self.msg.points = [self.point]
339  if not rospy.is_shutdown():
340  # publish message to actuate the dof
341  self.trajectory_pub.publish(self.msg)
342 
343  if sleep:
344  rospy.sleep(self.sleep_time_static)
345  else:
346  self.r.sleep()
347 
348  def set_positions_list(self, poses, sleep):
349  """
350  Set joint poses (positions)
351 
352  Arguments
353  ----------
354  poses: Special Data Structure
355  Loop through all the positions and velocities in the poses
356  poses = [pose, pose, ..., pose]
357  pose = [positions, velocities, string]
358  sleep: float
359  Set how long it should wait after commanding a command
360 
361  Returns
362  --------
363  return: None
364  """
365  self.pcm.switch_mode(ControllerType.POSITION)
366 
367  for each_pose in poses:
368  positions, _, pose_name = each_pose[0], each_pose[1], each_pose[2] # noqa: F841
369  self.pose_name = pose_name
370  self.publish_positions(positions, sleep)
371 
372  def set_velocities_list(self, poses, sleep):
373  """
374  Set poses (velocities)
375 
376  Arguments
377  ----------
378  poses: Special Data Structure
379  Loop through all the positions and velocities in the poses
380  poses = [pose, pose, ..., pose]
381  pose = [positions, velocities, string]
382  sleep: float
383  Set how long it should wait after commanding a command
384 
385  Returns
386  --------
387  return: None
388  """
389  self.pcm.switch_mode(ControllerType.VELOCITY)
390 
391  for each_pose in poses:
392  _, velocities, pose_name = each_pose[0], each_pose[1], each_pose[2] # noqa: F841
393  self.pose_name = pose_name
394  self.publish_velocities(velocities, sleep)
395 
396  def set_trajectory_list(self, poses, sleep):
397  """
398  Set poses (positions and velocities)
399 
400  Arguments
401  ----------
402  poses: Special Data Structure
403  Loop through all the positions and velocities in the poses
404  poses = [pose, pose, ..., pose]
405  pose = [positions, velocities, string]
406  sleep: float
407  Set how long it should wait after commanding a command
408 
409  Returns
410  --------
411  return: None
412  """
413  self.pcm.switch_mode(ControllerType.TRAJECTORY)
414 
415  # TODO: add accelerations
416  for each_pose in poses:
417  positions, velocities, pose_name = each_pose[0], each_pose[1], each_pose[2]
418  accelerations = np.zeros(7)
419  self.pose_name = pose_name
420  self.publish_trajectory(positions, velocities, accelerations, sleep)
421

424  # just 2 poses for now.

427  [[-0.5, -pi / 3, -pi / 4, 1, 1, 1, -pi / 4], [0, 0, -0.5, 0, 0, 0, 0], 'Pose_2']
428  ]
429  controller = PandaController()
430  controller.publish_velocities([0, 0.5, 0.5, 0, 0, 0, 0], 1)
